item.value: The most widely spoken language is Mandarin, nearly 1 billion people speak it, mainly in China.

The Spine-tailed Swift is the fastest bird. It can fly at 170 kilometres per hour (105mph). The Peregrine Falcon is the fastest bird that dives headfirst down through the sky. They can travel at up to 200mph.
A sneeze generates a wind of 166 km/hr (100 mi/hr), and a cough moves out at 100 km/hr (60 mi/hr).

Roughly 70 percent of an adult's body is made up of water.
The lowest temperature ever recorded world was at Vostok Station, Antarctica on the 21 July 1983. it was a bitter -89.6C
More than 1,000 different languages are spoken on the continent of Africa.
The Amazon is the second longest river. It is 6.400 km ( 4,000 miles ) long. It flows into the Atlantic ocean.
The Population of the Earth is about 6,800,000,000 (6.80 billion) people.
The tallest building in America is the Willius Tower in Chicago.
The shortest person in the world is Khagendra Thapa Maga. He is 56 cm ( 22 in ) tall.
Orville and Wilbur Wright achieved the first powered, sustained, and controlled flight of an airplane.on the morning of December 17, 1903. In 1919 the First transatlantic flight was made.
There are 9 planets that circle the sun.
John Logie Baird was the inventor of the world's first working television system in Hastings, England in 1923.
The world's oldest person was Kama Chinen. She lived in Japan and died a week before her 115th birthday.
New York is the city with the biggest population in America. It has over 8.3 million inhabitants. Los Angeles is in second place. It has 3.8 million people.
Opened in 2010, the Burj Khalifa in Dubai is the tallest building in the world.
The strongest wind ever recorded wind was on Mt Washington, New Hampshire, USA. It was an amazing 231mph.
Mount Everest is the tallest mountain in the world. It is 8850 meters (29035ft) high.
There are 195 countries in the world and there are more than 2,700 languages.
